intro: Uragoga mannii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, heart-shaped leaves and vibrant, showy flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers, which come in shades of purple, pink, and white, bloom throughout the year in suitable conditions. Uragoga mannii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
